now THIS is more like it; part of "the worst films ever made"

along with Salo, Men Behind the Sun, Cannibal Holocaust etc.

A New York anthropologist travels to the wild, inhospitable jungles of South America to find out what happened to a documentary film crew that disappeared two months before while filming a documentary about primitive cannibal tribes.

He finds the remains of the crew and several reels of their undeveloped film. Upon returning to New York City, he views the film.

It turns out that the film crew upon finding the natives to docile and boring for their documentary decide to push them... with horrific consequences.


this film shows just how cruel humans can be; murder, rape, forced abortion, REAL animal violence ..

Cannibal Holocaust was not a bad movie.
It become banned movie because it contained real animal mutilation and violence.
The animals killed and tortured in the movie were real.
It is how ever a cult movie.
